text_raw: As he stood thus and wept, lo, three Bright Ones came to him, and one of them said: Peace be to thee! thou hast grace from thy sins.

text: Christian gave three leaps for joy, and sang as he went Ah, what a place is this Blest cross Blest tomb
text_raw: Christian gave three leaps for joy, and sang as he went: Ah, what a place is this! Blest cross! Blest tomb!

text: He went on thus till he came to a vale where he saw three men who were in a sound sleep, with chains on their feet.
text_raw: He went on thus till he came to a vale where he saw three men who were in a sound sleep, with chains on their feet.

text: Christian. Sirs, whence come you, and where do you go?
text_raw: Christian. - Sirs, whence come you, and where do you go?

text: Formalist and Hypocrisy. We were born in the land of Vain glory, and are on our way to Mount Zion for praise.
text_raw: Formalist and Hypocrisy. - We were born in the land of Vain glory, and are on our way to Mount Zion for praise.

text: Know you not that he that comes not in at the door, but climbs up to get in, the same is a thief?
text_raw: Know you not that he that comes not in at the door, but climbs up to get in, the same is a thief?

text: They told Christian that he had no need for care on that score, for long use had made it law, and they could prove that it had been so for years.

text: Yes, said they, no doubt of it.

text: And if we get in the road at all, pray what are the odds?
text_raw: And if we get in the road at all, pray what are the odds?

text: Is not our case as good as yours?
text_raw: Is not our case as good as yours?

text: I saw then that they all went on till they came to the foot of the Hill of Difficulty, where there was a spring.

text: Now when Christian got as far as the Spring of Life he drank of it, and then went up the hill.

text: Now half way up was a cave made by the Lord of that hill, that those who came by might rest there.

text: Timorous said that Zion was the hill they meant to climb, but that when they had got half way they found that they met with more and more risk, so that great fear came on them, and all they could do was to turn back.
text_raw: Timorous said that Zion was the hill they meant to climb, but that when they had got half way they found that they met with more and more risk, so that great fear came on them, and all they could do was to turn back.

text: Yes, said Mistrust, for just in front of us there lay two beasts of prey in our path we knew not if they slept or not, but we thought that they would fall on us and tear our limbs.

text: He felt for it but found it not.

text: Oh, fool that I am said he, to sleep in the day time so to give way to the flesh as to use for ease that rest which the Lord of the hill had made but for the help of the soul

text: Such was the lot of the Jews for their sin they were sent back by the way of the Red Sea and I am made to tread those steps with grief which I might have trod with joy, had it not been for this sleep.

text: How far might I have been on my way by this time
text_raw: How far might I have been on my way by this time!

text: Now by this time he had come to the vale once more, where for a spell he sat down and wept but at last, as he cast a sad glance at the foot of the bench, he saw his scroll, which he caught up with haste, and put in his cloak.
